solution_line_template: Josh gave a total of {num_siblings} x {candies_per_sibling} = <<{num_siblings}*{candies_per_sibling}={candies_given_to_siblings}>>{candies_given_to_siblings} candies to his siblings.
He was then left with {initial_candies} - {candies_given_to_siblings} = <<{initial_candies}-{candies_given_to_siblings}={candies_after_siblings}>>{candies_after_siblings} candies.
He gave {candies_after_siblings}/{best_friend_divisor} = <<{candies_after_siblings}/{best_friend_divisor}={candies_given_to_best_friend}>>{candies_given_to_best_friend} candies to his best friend.

Since he only wants to eat {candies_josh_eats} candies, there are still {candies_after_best_friend} - {candies_josh_eats} = <<{candies_after_best_friend}-{candies_josh_eats}={candies_left_to_share}>>{candies_left_to_share} candies left to be shared with others.
